snippet: Michael Feinstein led a powerful night of tribute to the jazz singer Ethel Waters at Lincoln Center.
abstract: Stephen Holden reviews Jazz at Lincoln Center concert tribute to jazz singer Ethel Waters, hosted by Michael Feinstein. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Louis Armstrong, Sophie Tucker and Ethel Waters: modern popular and jazz singing sprang from this trinity, Michael Feinstein declared on Wednesday evening at the Allen Room, where he presented the Jazz at Lincoln Center program, ''Ethel Waters: Blues, Broadway and Jazz.'' In a culture whose collective historical memory begins with rock 'n' roll and television, Elvis Presley is commonly regarded as the prophetic entertainer of our time. But he could never have existed without these forerunners, who crossed boundaries and created generic musical hybrids as freely as he did.

headline.main: Honoring a Giant of Jazz With an Enduring Voice
